>>53081315
In the case of Pokémon it's more so the perception surrounding it which as noted by various sources it's intended. You see the perception of Pokémon as little critters in pretty much every space, memes like the Batman and Joker showcase this and seeing how widespread these memes are it shouldn't cost as a surprise. Thanks to leaked guides and the late Takeshi Shudo's blog, which he comments that it's a view point that's intended, we know that even the series itself pushes it. Combined with how entangled the furry subculture is with Pokémon it's no small wonder why that perception is so widespread in general.

>>53080332
None of that implies anything. It doesn't imply relationships, it's simply just written word in the pokedex, which as noted by Masuda may even be ignored if it gets in the way of how they want to portray Pokémon.

Pokémon as intended represent the critters Tajiri interacted with in his childhood while also doubling as good pets in the vain of cats and dogs, something he mentioned and made clear in his 2018 biography but also as early as 1995.

As Takeshi Shudo wrote, the anime staff, which in the planning stages would have likely involved Pokémon creators, decided to think of Pokémon as being like critter from the real world. Shudo in his blog even introduces Pokémon this way, as group of critters inspired by familiar objects and creatures. This is even the viewpoint given to us in the 2012 guide which explicitly tells us Pokémon replace the critters from the real world, and note that it never mentions monsters except not to call Pokémon that.

The series itself is even starting to reject the label monster for Pokémon and SV has dialogue to dissociate the label from Pokémon. Given that the series constructs domesticated Pokémon to be like dogs and cats, both in the way they're treated and how the act, and given that they also want people to view Pokémon as cute little critters and not monsters no one should act shocked when there's a push back against sexualization of what are essentially innocent creatures that occupy the sphere of being a pet and also being natural creatures. That perception lies in the way the series has chosen to construct Pokémon.

posts.com: No, it's レックウザ (Rekkūza), from 裂 (retsu), meaning rending/tearing, and 空 (kuu), meaning sky. The Japanese title of the seventh movie uses rekkuu 裂空 as a reference to Rayquaza. They chose to call it Rayquaza outside Japan so it wouldn't seem too Japanese. It's the official name in Japan too, but it's pronounced Rekkūza there. It's like how Shaymin is the official name in all languages, but the Japanese name is シェイミ (Sheimi) and comes from the Chinese 謝謝 (xièxie; thanks) and ハリネズミ (harinezumi; hedgehog). It would be more accurate to write it as Xiemi in English.

>>53082877
The english prenounciation of the japanese would be:
WRECK-KOO-ZAH

But the english name has a -Qu- that only has one pronounciation, which is "-Kw-"
So if you followed japanese name, it would be "wreck-kwoo-zah", which is negated by the A.
Closest pronounciation, then, is to turn that "Kwoo" into a "Kwa".

There's literally no reason to make it "Kway".
The connection to Quasars is tenuous at best and if they wanted it pronounced that way, there's half a dozen different ways they could have spelled it as such.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53082877
The question is over the pronunciation, not the spelling.
Trademarked Japanese name: レックウザ ("Rekkūza" in Hepburn romanization)
Trademarked Latin alphabet name: Rayquaza (used to officially represent the Japanese name as well when written in Latin letters on products and media).

Compared to say
Trademarked Japanese name: リザードン ("Rizādon" in Hepburn romanization)
Trademarked Latin alphabet name: Lizardon
Trademarked English name: Charizard

It is Rayquaza both within and outside of Japan, but it's meant to be pronounced Rekkūza (wrek-KOO-za, like how a pigeon coos or you say the French term coup d'etat) because its name is of Japanese origin. Its name was only trademarked in alphabetic script the way it was to retain consistency across all regions since it's a Legendary Pokémon and to make it seem more anglicized in western games.

If you want another example, Kyogre is a mess of a name, while in Japanese it's カイオーガ (Kaiōga), from 海 (kai; sea) and a slightly corrupted オーカ (ōka; orca). It has nothing to do with ogres.

posts.com:
https://old.reddit.com/r/PokemonUnite/comments/10jm9f5/respawn_timers_solved_by_mathcord/

L + K + P/40 + T

L represents level; as you increase in level, your respawn timer length will also increase. The values associated with each level can be found on the table,

K represents KO streak; every KO you’ve gotten since you last respawned will add 1 second to your respawn timer,

P represents points; every point you’ve scored since you last respawned will add 1/40th of a second to your respawn timer (or, every 40 points you score will add 1s to your respawn timer),

T represents time remaining; from the 2 minute mark onwards, 4 seconds will be added to your respawn timer, and from the 1 minute mark onwards, this increases to 10 seconds.

-Always heals for 75% HP

>Spit Up

>>53078972
Probably not. The only options for it to get that stand out are Electro Ball for PvE or Eerie Impulse for PvP. Even if Electro Ball had Frenzy Plant-level stats, it would still be a mediocre Pokémon compared to Electivire along with the electric-type legendaries and Xurkitree, and that's not even factoring in Shadow Electivire and Mega Manectric.

In PvP, Eelektross is pretty bad because it's too frail to last long and it doesn't do much damage since its best charge moves in that format aren't STAB. Getting a better fast move than Spark would be nice, but it wouldn't necessarily help its position. However, if we were to make Eerie Impulse an electric-type version of Acid Spary (except it decreases attack instead of defense) and give it to Eelektross, it could slow down an opponent that it swaps into. Then again, it being so frail means that you'll probably just find yourself asking "Wouldn't it just be better if Eelektross could one-shot its opponents like Electivire. or weather attacks so that it can live beyond two charge moves like Magnezone, or have a better typing and a better overall moveset like Galvantula?"

Unless they give it Thunder Sho- oh wait it can't learn that... Unless they also give it a better fast move (maybe make Thunder Wave an electric-type Bullet Seed) or heavily buff Acid, there's basically no chance Eelektross is ever seen outside niche play in something like the Electric Cup.

>Why was the chief repeating this again?

>"Gotta say, you did one helluva job on that house."

>He tapped the photograph of the aftermath, as if you needed a reminder.
>The whole side of the house was blown inward.
>"Exactly three point two seconds later, you KO'd his pet umbreon and had the man in a headlock."
>The chief shook his head dismissively.
>"Good thing you didn't snap the poor lad's neck."
>You winced at the thought of killing an innocent man.
>It's your fault.
>You trusted command got the address right without double-checking.
>"Well, missy, let's all say a big thank you to the big man upstairs, 'cause nothin' short of a miracle just happened."
"Sir?" The timid Lucairo replied.
>"This was nothing short of a slam dunk case against us. No lawyer could've messed this up if they tried."
>"Turns out, Mr. Anon's a very forgiving man."
>For the first time in weeks, your ears perked up in hope.
>"Won't bore you with the legalese, but here's the jist of it."
>"The man could've bankrupted the department twice over, but all he's asking for are some repairs and remodeling. And paying the pet's poke-center bill too."
>"That is, on one condition. And that's why you're here."
>You sat up straighter, eager to help.
>"Bizarre as it may seem, you're our bargaining chip."
>"He insisted you keep your job, first off."
>"Can't say the same for others involved in this clown show."
>"Second, he wants to get to know you better."
>"Wants you to train him, can you believe it?"
>"Says he wanted to meet you a couple hours each day to exercise. And it could only be you."
>You said a silent 'thank you' to Arceus.
>"Now, look, the whole deal rides on this. Made it damn clear there's no alternative."
>"We're all losing our jobs if you don't do it."
>"Now, I can't make you..."
>You didn't hesitate. You nodded furiously.
>"Atta girl."
>"Here's his new address."

This. In the case of HGSS, I think it’s only better than GSC when it comes to the post game. If I ever make a romhack, it’s going to be a simple edit of GSC featuring:

>1
All Gen 2 mon (aside from Larvitar line) available in Johto; all mon available without trades.

>2
Stat fixes. Sneasel is complete shit for having unusable STAB. Kingler could use some SPA. Hypno was gutted by the special stat split. Some mon are simply shit (Ledian is actually better than yanma kek). Many such cases.

>3
Reusable TMs and removable HMs.

>4
Higher level mon in some areas. I can’t recall ever needing to grind, but this would be handy for swapping team composition.

That’s all I feel like GSC needs, realistically. I know there are ways to modify/improve the box system now, but I’m unsure if that could still be played without emulation.

>What is it?
https://www.pokeclicker.com/
Pokéclicker is an open-source game built around the story and content of the Pokémon games. This is an idle & clicker type game that is currently in beta release phase. New content and patches are released frequently.

>Crobat?
https://crobat4.github.io/pokeclicker/
A modified version of Pokeclicker that features QoL changes from the original, including a Dock shortcut, type-based pokeball selection, Gen 3+ berries being available in dungeons, un-nerfed experience gains, and some egg-exclusive pokemon being available through other means.

>Wiki
https://pokeclicker.miraheze.org/wiki/Home_Page

posts.com: Why would you ever want to remove a vitamin

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53054649
Vitamins only benefit the pokemon when it is hatched.
What good is a vitamin on a pokemon, if you don't hatch that egg anymore?
It doesn't do anything but change the time, and points you get from hatching pokemon.

Meaning removing it, won't do anything to the pokemon's stats, unless you want to start hatching the eggs again.

Its good they allow you to reallocate it to a pokemon of which can make better use of it for your hatching habits.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53043330
Hey, that's cool. I was just curious since the threads here always seems collector focus.

Radiant Pokemon are Pokemon that you can only have one of in your deck, but they're have powerful effects or attacks. So it's fun to try and choose which Radiant you want to use or work into your deck. Pic rel is one of the most popular ones, discard pile setup and drawing is really good for a lot of decks.

Radiant Eternatus is the main new one from CZ people like. When you bench it, you can search your deck for any two VMAX Pokemon and bench them as well. Which opens up a lot of opportunities for faster VMAX play.

>>53058196
>I was surprised people can just join games without even having the mod
The game is just a sandbox, when you sub to a workshop you're just getting a .json file telling the game to load different images, models, etc
Anybody that joins will just load the same information, the game will actually download these assets to make loading faster but if you don't want to clog your disk space turn Mod Cache off in the options.

>perhaps there should be a Steam group or something for Pokemon matchmaking
There probably is, lots of TTS discords popped up after the death of Global Chat, a shame. You could also host a lobby and post the info here so other anons can join. I don't play much these days but doing drafted/booster deck matches could be fun.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: I'm excited and nervous about starting Emerald after finishing Crystal. Do you guys particularly concerned with Natures/Abilities/EVs or do you just roll with the punches?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53027277
Depends on the encounter and game state, some pokemon become liabilities with a bad nature, IVs, and movepool; like -SpA Ralts with poor SpA IVs. While fine as a Gardevoir later on due to the huge Base Stat it won't be strong enough to get there as a normal party member considering it's after the fourth badge. Then at the point where you could level it up to use it, you'll have access to other pokemon, hopefully ones with better stat distributions.

Some notable ones with the issue are
>Treecko
The worst starter in terms of early-mid game
>Poochyena
Without a decent Atk/SpA, won't do enough damage until you it before Wattson. Has Howl but is way too frail to use it. Mightyena has some utility however.
>Beautifly
Too weak and limited in moves to handle poor offensive stats
>Lombre and Nuzleaf
They need stats to balance out their awful movepools
>Ralts
As stated above

Then there's the inverse
>Mudkip and Torchic
Decent moves, coverage, and resistances balance out poor stats
>Zigzagoon
Has pick Up and gets early Headbutt which is a STAB 70 power move with a flinch chance, that with Sand-Attack, Tail Whip and Growl gives a way to set up for other pokemon
>Taillow and Wingull
Access to early Wing Attack and Water gun, respectively, are extremely useful and strong.
>Dustox
It doesn't rely on its stats as it's focused on status and support

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
This one cut a little closer than it should have, but 10th game in the challenge is done

Lorelei and Bruno were dealt with Calm Mind sweeps from Slowbro, then instead of risking it through the status effects that Agatha tried to put me through, I pulled out Substitute Raticate. Deny status effects then sweep with Shadow Ball

Things didn't go as planned vs Lance, though. Blogpost incoming
>lead Butterfree to sleep Gyarados so Slowbro can setup
>Gyarados immediately wakes up
>to kill Gyarados and the incoming Dragonair but now Slowbro is at 1/3
>swap to Nidoking
>ice beam city
>freezes Dragonite
>promptly thaws and kills Nidoking with a crit Outrage
Ninetales dealt the final blow but that sucked, now I'm missing a lot of coverage and bulk vs Rival

>lead Raticate vs Pidgeot
>TWave then set up sub on Sand Attack
>kill with Return
>kill Alakazam with Shadow Ball
>Exeggutor comes in and TWave'd
>switch Slowbro and Calm Mind twice
>Ice Beam the eggs
>Gyarados comes in
>crits Bite twice
>leaves me at 20 HP
>in a panic, misplay and switch out, should have just sacrificed him for a free switch
>send out Butterfree
>Toxic then Protect/Psychic until we're both in the red
>predict his Full Restore and put him to sleep in the same turn (felt really good about this one)
>swap into Raticate and set up another sub, then kill with Return
>Charizard comes out and Fire Blasts the sub away
>swap into Ninetales and absorb his next Fire Blast with Flash Fire
>for some reason it Fire Blasts again while I confuse and slowly chip it with HP Electric
>Rhydon comes in
>can't safely switch into anything since Rock Tomb or EQ will kill
>confuse and burn before going down
>send out Raticate
>sub for safety and kill with Return

I had plenty of misplays (including not bringing a 6th to E4) but some of my predictions left me feeling really good, and I can't feel too bad by going all the way with Raticate and Butterfree lol. Rest easy, Mr. Nido and Azsakano.

Clair time, after an excessively long and pointless Rocket and grinding session.
Plan? Lead Parasect, Spore Gyarados and sucks him dry I guess.

Kingdra next, I try to switch back to Parasect in hopes of more Sleep spreading, but take too much damage from Not Hydro Pump.

Second Dragonair comes out, at which point I go to Girafarig, failing to get the kill due to Paralysis before going back to Mommy Milkers for a lossless win.

Did not go ideally, but good enough.

>Lance
I had a plan for this involving Agility Passing for the Mamoswine sweep, unfortunately that was no longer an option.
So before the battle, I give Miltank Thunderbolt, and Mamoswine Ice Beam.
Miltank leads, and it turns out, Gyarados struggles with SubMilk too, eventually falling to weather phenomena caused by a cow. Something about Greek mythology goes here.
Unfortunately, this is where it all goes downhill. I need to get Mamoswine in safely, but Miltank can't tank the strongest of the Dragonites indefinitely. Eventually I'm forced to switch in hopes of Outrage hitting in confusion, going to Sudowoodo instead, as probably the most expendable of the team.
He's able to Rock Slide the Dragonite, leading to the second one to come in. I'm not sure which one it is, so I stay in. Turns out it went for Thunder, which would've been a safe switch for Mamoswine. RIP Sudowoodo, your sacrifice won't be forgotten.
Mamoswine puts the DNite to ice, leading to Charizard.
I chose to believe Ancient Power would KO. I was wrong. Should've switched to Magcargo. Two hits was still enough, but Mamoswine is at critical health.
And Lance elects to throw out Dragonite instead of Aerodactyl.
So Lance is down to just Aerodactyl now. I switch to Magcargo here, not wanting to lose Mamoswine, and then go for Yawn. Magcargo lives at critical health, and it's clear that a sack is needed. In the end, while it's certainly the wrong choice in terms of future success, it's time for the milk factory to close down. RIP Miltank, what an absolute unit.
After this, Mamoswine comes in to clean house with Ice Beam + Ice Shard.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53079470
For the Pawmi line, I think the Fighting aspects are drawing off of the idea of open-hand slaps, or palm-strikes to fit with the name. Pawmo's dex entry seems to focus more on the Fighting type aspects, and the fact it learns Arm Thrust probably ties into all of this.
Granted, I'm not sure why they went that direction for the pikaclone for the region, but it doesn't strike me as that much stranger than some other Fighting types.
Quaquaval and Flamigo strike me as very different directions in terms of kicking. The former falls more under being a humanoid dancer, while Flamigo seems like it would be more in line with a secretary bird and fall into a similar vein as Mankey, where it's an animal that can use make use of punches and kicks, rather than being a full-on humanoid.

Designs like Paldean Tauros, Slither Wing, Great Tusk, and Koraidon strike me much more as outliers. All of them seem like they're using Fighting type purely in the context of being muscular.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53079820
>Designs like Paldean Tauros, Slither Wing, Great Tusk, and Koraidon strike me much more as outliers. All of them seem like they're using Fighting type purely in the context of being muscular.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53080642
I don't even think it'd be impossible to salvage some of them.
Koraidon in particular could easily be tweaked with Dex entries that imply a greater degree of actual fighting technique, like saying it used to wrestle with ancient monsters, or was rumored to have taught early warriors how to fight. Perhaps at least some sort of Aura connection if they were feeling lazy. Being able to get Aura Sphere from a TM, even if it's off only 80 special attack, would at least imply a greater connection there.

Paldean Tauros in turn could potentially work if greater emphasis was placed on the idea of bull-fighting with it, and giving it the attitude of the matador rather than the raging bull. Swap out Anger point for another ability and give it moves like Counter and Detect that put a focus on it being more cautious. That still isn't great, but as it stands Paldean Tauros is just described as muscular and fierce, which is the same as most other Tauros dex entries.

Slither Wing and Great Tusk should have types changed entirely. I would say Bug/Ground for the former, since Earthquake or Stomping Tantrum is still plenty primal. Then perhaps Ground/Normal for the latter, to let it represent that brute force with powerful STAB normal attacks, or if Gamefreak really wanted to avoid Normal type Paradox mons, then I could also see Ground/Dark, focusing on moves like Brutal Swing or Knock Off as a way to represent it being a highly aggressive brute.

While I do think it is possible to have Fighting types that aren't just humanoid martial artists, it feels like little to no effort was made to try and justify it for some of Gen 9's designs.

One of the programmers was clearly a Unovafan. H. Samurott didn’t just win, it basically became the Charizard of PLA.

Ghost is an inherently good type on offensive Pokémon, and Fire/Ghost alone is solid coverage, 119SpA is incredible for a starter and dropping down to 95 speed isn’t too bad since not many things relevant things brewed 95-100 speed. Eruption and Focus 70% Blast/30%Miss from Typhlosion prime help a lot. And getting Calm Mind is excellent, letting it set up its already high SpA along woth patching up it SpD which synergizes well with Infernal Parade causing burns.

>>53073217
Centering is mildly important, but it’s always been the least important aspect of a card’s quality (in terms of grading, tolerances for centering are looser than tolerances for actual damage, for instance). Newfags are only obsessed with centering because it doesn’t take a discerning eye to see when a card’s off-center, and presumably they only own/open shitty modern cards, where condition barely enters into things.

And to the retard who brought up dpi in the last thread: that’s cool and all, but totally irrelevant. We were talking about QC in relation to grading pack fresh cards. Japanese cards aren’t going to be docked for their sub-par inking or something. But WotC cards will be docked when the holos come fresh from their packs with print lines, chipping, and silvering.

>>53078957
The ratio between the value of a 9 and a 10 is all completely dependent on the card. Some PSA tens have taken off in value, others have stayed the same relative to their corresponding 9s. Take the CD promo starters. Back in 2016, PSA 9s sold for half the price of PSA 10s, and that's still more or less true for those cards, even the Charizard. Or take Base Venusaur: PSA 10 used to sell for about 3-4x the PSA 9, and that's still true today.

But then look at, like, Jungle Clefairy. Unlimited or 1st ed 10s used to sell for about 10x the 9s, and now they sell for closer to 15x or even 20x. And this Shining Mew in particular. Used to be 2:1, now the 10 is worth more like 5-7x the 9. Couldn't tell you why.

Anyways, have fun Brionne lovers. I know I had a lot of fun making it.

>>53081696
I had a friend disown me because of my criticism towards this franchise, and others. Apparently the idea of still playing these games when I disagree with certain decisions or dislike a lack of polish means that I am just an irredeemable human being.
He is in his 30s, lives with his mother and about 2000 anime figures, and has zero savings. He now has zero friends he can interact with in the real world. I took it upon myself to keep tabs on him through online posts on accounts he didn't know I knew about, mainly to check he hadn't committed suicide, as he would often attention-monger with posts on the matter.
I recently caught him insulting me behind my back because I was playing Scarlet but I disliked Dexit. At this point, we had not spoken in a year, and the last time we discussed Dexit of all things would have been well over 3 years ago. I appreciate that he's got literally nothing more interesting going on in his life, but I remember that original conversation, and it seemed like a relatively balanced pros and cons discussion between the two of us, long before Swash actually released. Little did I know that he was bubbling with autistic rage just under the surface that I would dare insult his beloved Pokémon.
Was kind of the last straw for me, really. I wish you all the best, but I imagine the next time I say your name will probably be when your mother invites me to the funeral

>>53080532
One of the reasons Why I liked Skeledirge is because of how it hard counters almost everything that dog has if you take terrastalising out of the equation to the point where its comical. Its resists both its stabs and a decent amount of its coverage, immune to its best fighting coverage and ignores intrepid sword thanks to unaware plus (while nerfed in the PP department) it has recovery via slack off. The only thing Zacian has that can deal with it is its dark coverage and even then Crunch is the only good option with how bulky (and slow which makes assurance too weak to be effective) dirge is. It’s basically almost a better check than quagsire in this specific matchup as it can reliably take almost everything that mutt dishes out.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
In the 1999 video game Pokemon Gold/Silver, there is a location in the game known as Azalea Town. It is one of the earlier towns, and the player will typically pay their first visit here within the first few hours of gameplay. However, this town has a unique property.

There are usually 5 central buildings in this town - a Pokemon Centre, Poke Mart, Gym, Charcoal Kiln and Kurt’s House (where the player can obtain custom Poke Balls).

But there is one more house in the town that was thought to have been long discarded at the beta stages of development. The purpose of this building is unknown and it does not have an official name - it has often been disregarded as false memory or a Mandela effect. The truth is that the data for this house is still present on some existing copies of Pokemon Gold/Silver. There are no known methods to consistently spawn the house, but what we do know is that the presence of the house is tied to the save file - if you visit Azalea Town for the first time on a new save and the house is not there, it never will be.

The house is located southeast of the Gym. However, the entrance to the house is mostly blocked off by trees - the only way to gain access to this house is to walk to the far southwest end of the town where a pool of water emerges from the trees.

This L-shaped body of water contains a Whirlpool. This is essentially a roadblock and cannot be passed over unless the player’s Pokemon know the hidden moves Surf and Whirlpool - these hidden moves are not obtained until much later in the game. It is therefore likely that the developers intended for the player to revisit Azalea town once they had obtained these moves to discover the secret of the hidden house.

Sightings of this house are extremely rare, but oddly, the few people who have encountered this phenomenon first-hand all give it the same nickname independently of one another. They know it as the Azalea Whirlpool House.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53079298
Even more strangely - those who have visited the Azalea Whirlpool House cannot recall its purpose. They cannot remember if there are any humans or Pokemon that live there, or if you obtain any items or pertinent information there.

In 2008, a group of university freshmen formed a bond over their love of video games and would meet regularly on weekends to play games together. One day, when discussing their favourite childhood games, Pokemon Gold/Silver came up in the conversation. One particular member of this group (let’s call him John) exclaimed that he hated the Azalea Whirlpool House and that it ruined the game for him. This turned into a heated debate when the other members of the group insisted that there was no such location, and this was exacerbated by the fact that John himself could not remember why he hated the house or what the house was there for.

The next weekend, John had found his old copy of Pokemon Silver and the save file was still intact. He went to Azalea Town and there, clear as day, was the Azalea Whirlpool House. John turned off his Game Boy, put it into his bag, and went to the meet-up with his friends.

He was excited to show his friends the secret house and prove them wrong. But unfortunately, if you ask John what happened when he showed his friends the Azalea Whirlpool House, the last thing he remembers was the player character walking through the front door of the house. A few days later, the internal battery in the game cart died, so this save file no longer exists.

Co-director Junichi Masuda is supposedly dismissive of the Azalea Whirlpool House and apparently claims it was discarded because it “didn’t look right on the map”. Lead director Satoshi Tajiri, however, reportedly becomes extremely agitated if you bring the subject up - he vehemently denies its existence.

Halfway into my autistic thought experiment, I will summarize the movie as if they were ash and misty.
spoilers for "When Harry Met Sally"


>Ash and Misty meet when they were rather young
>The two immediately start bickering
>Misty is clearly amused by him but feels the need to present herself as hating him
>Ash is smug and unaffected, saying increasingly callous things
>Years pass before they ever see each other again
>During these years they have a few chance encounters
>Eventually one of these chance encounters lead to Ash and Misty regularly spending time together, going places together.
>They pick up where they left off, only both are more mature and experienced this time
>Ash is as cocky as ever, he seems to think he understands the world now
>Misty thinks he's cocky, but enjoys spending as much time as possible
>Misty is still insecure about rather inoccuous things like telling Ash about men she's been interested in
>Ash finds this silly.
>Their close friends find it strange that Ash and Misty are not dating
>Ash's explanation is that he can say whatever he wants to Misty without worrying if she'll find it offensive. She does find things he says offensive, but they never drive her off. Ash believes the key to this is that they are friends, not lovers
>Ash and Misty carry on their joyous travels, best friends, for now
>Ash and Misty spend new years eve together, they don't have a date, so they might as well spend time with their best friend
>They dance at a new years event. They joke about how they can dance cheek to cheek and its nothing to them
>They start paying attention to the lyrics of the background music, the song is about how friends can become lovers
>They awkwardly stare each other in the eyes for a moment. Misty looks ready for a kiss
>The new years countdown is starting
>Ash breaks the tension with a casual "Wanna go get some air?"
>They're outside, the new year began. They look around, everyone's kissing. They peck on the mouth and laugh

Part 2 of "When Ash Met Misty.

>Brief timeskip
>Ash and Misty are going to introduce their respective best friends to each other.
>Ash's friend finds the entire concept of Misty absurd. A woman who is attractive, has a good personality, spends a lot of time with Ash, and Ash does not wish to date her? Ash's friend believes Ash is lying about one of these things
>Ash is a little bothered and does a whole spiel about how Misty is in fact, all of those things.
>Ash and Misty have a plan. Ash's friend dates Misty, Misty's friend date Ash. This way their friend groups can be merged and they can stay platonic
>The plan is starting to fail, Ash and Misty's friends show interest in EACH OTHER
>The plan crashes, Ash and Misty go back to their friendship while their friends go home together
>Ash runs into a woman from his past and her new husband, he plays it off
>It becomes apparent that it's bothering him
>Ash and Misty get into an argument about how he can't seem to hide his emotions, and Misty is always hiding them.
>Timeskip, Ash and Misty are still close friends, dating other people
>Timeskip again. Misty is upset that a previous boyfriend is getting married, Ash chooses to comfort her, one thing leads to another and they bang
>Ash and Misty are terrified of what this would do to their friendship, they both play it off and try to pretend it didn't happen
>Doesn't last, Misty can only keep up the act for so long, she is furious that Ash doesn't think it meant anything.
>Ash is upset that it can't just be a random moment in their lives
>Misty is clearly upset about how easily ash was able to move on, how easily he was able to walk away
>Misty slaps ash, ending the argument
>Misty has cut off Ash, Ash has been sending her increasingly comedic messages to get her attention
>She eventually answers when he tries singing.
>Ash apologizes, asks if they want to be new years dates (every year if they have no date, they just default to each other to hang out)
>Misty declines

Serious question: where are the pedophiles?

The entire franchise, every single game, is based on children leading adventurous lives away from home because they have absentee fathers and mothers that pray to whatever deities exist that their kid gets lost on the way back home after going to play outside.

This setting should be ripe for adults looking to ravage and violate small children, statistically speaking, but not a single pedophile exists. I can only suspend my disbelief for so much--there should be at least a couple of rapists around. Child trafficking business should be booming. There should be hundreds of thousands of missing persons cases on an annual basis.

Speaking of rapists, where are the soldiers? Where are the guns? Where is the adult that gets challenged by an obnoxious group of kids and just straight up pulls a pistol and guns them down like some stray hoodlums that were trying to pick a fight after the guy just finished his 6-9 day job?

There are a lot of missing elements with this Pokemon stuff and I personally believe that the series suffers for it.

Normal, Physical, 70bp

Ground, Status
Surrounds the user and their allies in a cloud of protective dust. The user's team is now immune to sand, spore and powder for the next 5 turns

Ground, Status
Throws a ball of dust at the target which bursts into a cloud of fine particles and covers them. The target becomes a Ground-type.

>Dust Devil
Ground, Special, 70bp
Can hit Flying-types and Pokemon with Levitate. This also deals SE damage against Flying-type Pokemon.

Poison, Physical, 90bp, 95%
Crushes the target with a powerful force. Has a 30% chance to lower Defense -2.

Ice, Physical, 100bp, 90%
The user lowers their head and drives a large pile of snow into the opponent. If there are hazards on the user's side of the field, they are now cleared and this move deals double damage.

>Backdraft
Fire, Physical, 90bp, 95%
25% recoil

>Dismantle
Normal, Physical, 20bp
Removes any screens on the target's side of the field. If hitting a Steel-type, this also has a 100% chance to lower their Def and SpDef -1 each.

posts.com:
>>53078032
I honestly disagree. It makes it much more useful for doubles and actually gives a purpose for that low level move to stick around. I wish they would go back and tweak some of the other low level moves to make them more viable. We're at a point now where there is some variety in move selection at the competitive level, but you still have some centralizing moves that everybody might as well use if they get them like Close Combat or Knock Off. I want more variety, and I do think a simple way of doing that is just taking those crappy low level moves that you learn in the early game and just giving them more utility. And I think a simple way to do that is to give them secondary effects or buffs that you only really notice when you're playing in the late game or competitive. For example, in regular play the fact that string shot halves speed is nice but you're never going to notice that it does it to both opponents since that doesn't really happen in game.

>Leer
Lowers the target's Defense -1 AND blocks them from using status moves against you or your ally on that turn (they can still use self-inflicting status moves). Doesn't affect Pokemon who block Intimidate.

>Tail Whip
Lowers the defense of both opponents by one AND now deals weak spread damage (maybe 20bp?)

>Meditate
Boosts Attack AND SpDef +1 each (somebody will find that useful)

>Sharpen
Boosts Attack +1 AND gives your next cutting move a power boost (maybe other things will learn this attack now)

>Defense Curl
Buffs Def +1 (and inc BP of certain moves) but also makes you immune to bomb and ball moves on that turn

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53078102
>>Thick fog
I feel like if they implement fog, they're going to have to come up with a whole new mechanic for it to work. I do agree on some of your ideas, like maybe certain types can ignore it. But I think it should actually stack with certain weather, namely snow and rain, while being cleared by sand and sun. I also think that defog and wind-based move should get rid of it as well. But it should last five turns like a weather and other field effects. I think it should also increase the efficacy of moves like mist, by making them last a little bit longer. It can even have a tandem effect with Misty terrain but I'm not sure what that would be

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I remember having a bunch of ideas for trying to buff Poison way back before Fairy came out, and I think a lot of these could still work

Moves

>Garbage Guard
Poison type protect that halves incoming damage for both you and your ally

>Cesspool
Creates a pool of pollution on the opponent's side of the field. Deals 6.25% damage to Pokémon on the opposing side at the end of every turn. Pokémon who are airborne avoid this, steel types and Pokémon immune to poisoning won't take damage, and poison types will absorb it. It can be removed like other hazards

>Concoction
Poison type special move that deals varying damage of different types based on the user's hold item. With no hold item, it's a special poison move. But if the hold item is one of the type boosting items, this move becomes a poison + that type move when dealing damage similar to flying press

>Befoul
Makes the current terrain polluted and changes its effects. Fails if there is no terrain active. The terrains will actually change names and their five turn timer is reset. For every terrain, the types that they normally boost are now weakened and any beneficial effects they provided are now removed (So no healing on grass, psychic doesn't block priority, etc). Ground types are now stronger on grassy terrain, poison types are stronger on misty terrain. Dragon is neutral in mist. Also terrain pulse becomes a poison move

>Acid Rain
Poison weather effect that works like hail / sandstorm. Has no effect on poison and steel types.

>Spit Venom & Cobra Strike
Priority poison moves. The first is the special one, the second is the physical one

>Junk Shield
A steel type protect that treats the user as a steel type when taking damage for just that turn

>Rotten
Reverses the effects of all berries while this Pokémon is in play

>Waste Disposal
This Pokémon absorbs entry hazards when switching in or when they are used, restoring HP
